item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, February 8, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. VSCode's SSH agent is bananas (229 points | 112 comments)
2. Hotline for modern Apple systems (53 points | 15 comments)
3. LINUX is obsolete (1992) (16 points | 9 comments)
4. Why gold loves arsenic (2021) (15 points | 1 comment)

6. The PS2's backwards compatibility from the engineer who built it (2020) (74 points | 12 comments)
7. A better (than Optional) maybe for Java (11 points | 7 comments)
8. Value-Based Deep RL Scales Predictably (11 points | discuss)
9. A brief history of code signing at Mozilla (190 points | 67 comments)
10. Implementing a Game Boy emulator in Ruby (35 points | 4 comments)

13. A colorful Game of Life (37 points | 8 comments)

15. Asahi Linux lead developer Hector Martin resigns from Linux kernel (581 points | 520 comments)
16. Station of despair: What to do if you get stuck at end of Tokyo Chuo Rapid Line (337 points | 198 comments)

19. Five coding hats (9 points | 23 comments)
20. U.K. orders Apple to let it spy on users' encrypted accounts (166 points | 695 comments)
21. Stop using zip codes for geospatial analysis (2019) (156 points | 117 comments)
22. Zep AI (YC W24) is hiring engineers to build SOTA agent memory ( | hide)
23. Unobtanium 6502 based KIM-1 part now obtanium with FPGA (14 points | 3 comments)
24. Bolt: Bootstrap long chain-of-thought in LLMs without distillation [pdf] (6 points | 1 comment)
25. Why LLMs still have problems with OCR (77 points | 68 comments)
26. Radiation belts detected around Earth after solar storm (120 points | 51 comments)
27. The evolution of annunciator signaling for telephones (68 points | 11 comments)
28. Three-nanite: Unreal Nanite in Three.js (179 points | 31 comments)
29. Docker Bake is now generally available (23 points | 7 comments)
30. Procedural Hydrology: Dynamic lake and river simulation (2020) (28 points | 4 comments)
